creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: three men wearing orange turbans and shirts seated on an elephant who is adorned with an orange, green and brown scarf on the top of its head, gold necklaces and white scrolling designs on its face; other figures wearing predominately white with bright-colored turbans in foreground and at left behind elephant and on rooftops of salmon-colored building at left; oxen at bottom left
marks: Signature, Title and Date LLC below image, in light brown: [Festival in Jaip
medium: Woodblock print; ink and colors on paper
title: Festival in Jaipur
